definition: chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain

sentences.english: They are heaping chain on chain around the limbs of their subjects.
sentences.chinese: 他們在自己臣民的手腳上套上更多的鎖鏈。

sentences.english: It is hard to free fools from the chains they revere.
sentences.chinese: 將愚人從他們所敬拜的鎖鏈下解放出來是非常困難的。

sentences.english: He was upside down in a tank of water with chains and lodes all around the lank .
sentences.chinese: 他倒立在一個水箱中，水箱外都盤着鎖鏈。

sentences.english: We repent, we abjure, we will break from our chain.
sentences.chinese: 我們懺悔，棄絕，要把鎖鏈打破。

sentences.english: At once all the prison doors flew open, and everybody's chains came loose.
sentences.chinese: 監門立刻全開，衆囚犯的鎖鏈也都鬆開了。

sentences.english: One model has a locking hinged cover for further security.
sentences.chinese: 另一款防護罩帶有鎖鏈，進一步保護了設備的安全。

sentences.english: Thy clanking chain, and Erin's yet green wounds.
sentences.chinese: 你鎖鏈的鋃鐺，愛爾蘭的新傷。

sentences.english: Description: An exquisite cloth and chain hauberk.
sentences.chinese: 一款精緻的布質和鎖鏈鎖子甲。

sentences.english: Chains shall He break, for the slave is our brother.
sentences.chinese: 衪將砸碎鎖鏈，因是我們的兄弟受捆綁。

sentences.english: Every man is a vital link in the great chain.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都是鎖鏈中至關重要的一環。

sentences.english: Rhaegal, still chained, was gnawing on the carcass of a bull.
sentences.chinese: 雷哥則依舊被鎖鏈拴住，正啃噬着牛骨的燒焦殘餘。

sentences.english: Fixed to the chain were keys, bank-books , money-boxes, and other heavy things.
sentences.chinese: 在鎖鏈上綁着鑰匙，賬本，錢箱，還有其他貴重物品。

sentences.english: I can't jump over the chain but what about taking a stretch.
sentences.chinese: 我走不出一條鎖鏈的範圍，但伸個懶腰總可以吧。

sentences.english: But the sense of triumph must come from the memory of the chain.
sentences.chinese: 但勝利意義之產生，必須來自鎖鏈的回憶。

sentences.english: The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains . They have a world to win.
sentences.chinese: 無產者失去的只是鎖鏈，他們獲得的將是整個世界。

definition: to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to turn a blind eye to
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
